main_definition: Jon is a common given name, but it can also refer to several idiomatic expressions in English.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A diminutive form of the name John, often used affectionately or familiarly
meanings_and_examples.example: My friend's little brother is named Jon; he's just three years old.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An idiomatic expression meaning someone who is not serious and tends to joke a lot
meanings_and_examples.example: Don't take his joking so seriously, Jon always has a playful sense of humor.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A colloquial term for an object or person that seems small or insignificant in comparison to others
meanings_and_examples.example: In the crowd, I felt like just another Jon, unnoticed and easily overlooked.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An abbreviation of 'Jonathan', a name derived from Hebrew meaning 'son of John'
meanings_and_examples.example: My colleague named his son Jonathan, which is an English version of the biblical name Jon.
